reuo.resources.format

Interface Formatter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Gray8toRgb16, PassthroughByte, Rgb15To16, Rgb15To16Flipped, Rgb15To16Masked

    public interface Formatter
    A pixel formatter. Both the input and output format are dependent on the implementing class. For example, Rgb15To16Masked formats pixels from 15-bit color without alpha to 16-bit pixels with alpha using a color key.
    Author:
    Kristopher Ives, Lucas Green

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.nio.Buffer format(java.nio.ByteBuffer src, int width, int height, reuo.util.Rect coords)
      Formats pixels into a Buffer from the provided ByteBuffer.
      java.nio.Buffer format(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel channel, int width, int height)
      Deprecated. 
      we should be using all ByteBuffer logic

    • Method Detail

      • format

        java.nio.Buffer format(java.nio.ByteBuffer src,
                     int width,
                     int height,
                     reuo.util.Rect coords)
                       throws java.nio.BufferUnderflowException
        Formats pixels into a Buffer from the provided ByteBuffer. The resulting buffer will represent the formatted image within the cropping coordinates coords; or if coords was null the entire source image with the dimensions width and height.

        The position of the src Buffer should be respected as well as the limit. The limit of the returned Buffer should also be respected, and the position will be undefined.

        The ByteOrder of src should be respected and used for the resulting Buffer

        Parameters:
        src - the data for the source image
        width - the total width of src
        height - the total height of src
        coords - the coordinates of the image; or null if no cropping occurs
        Returns:
        the formatted pixels
        Throws:
        java.nio.BufferUnderflowException - if there was not enough data in src

      • format

        java.nio.Buffer format(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel channel,
                     int width,
                     int height)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. we should be using all ByteBuffer logic
        Formats pixels into a Buffer from the provided input channel. The position of the returned Buffer will be undefined, but the limit should be respected.
        Parameters:
        channel - the source of pixels.
        width - the width of the source image
        height - the height of the source image
        Returns:
        the formatted pixel data with the constrained limit.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any IO errors occured
